qas.question: When was the greylag goose first domesticated by humans?

answers.text: The greylag goose (Anser anser) was domesticated by the Egyptians at least 3000 years ago

qas.question: What other name is the swan goose know by ?
Where is it believed that the greylag goose was first domesticated in theworld?
Are geese an important part of the poultry industry?

answers.text: Despite their early domestication, geese have never gained the commercial importance of chickens and ducks.

qas.question: When was the greylag goose domesticated by the Romans?
What other name is the swan goose no longer known by?
Where is it believed that the greylag goose was never domesticated?
What is no longer an important part of the poultry industry?

context: <a0_0>The greylag goose (Anser anser) was domesticated by the Egyptians <b4_0>at least 3000 years ago<b4_0/><a0_0/>, and a different wild species, the swan goose (Anser cygnoides), domesticated in <a2_0><b6_0>Siberia<b6_0/><a2_0/> about a thousand years later, is known as a <a1_0><b5_0>Chinese goose<b5_0/><a1_0/>. The two hybridise with each other and the large knob at the base of the beak, a noticeable feature of the Chinese goose, is present to a varying extent in these hybrids. The hybrids are fertile and have resulted in several of the modern breeds. <a3_0>Despite their early domestication, <b7_0>geese<b7_0/> have never gained the commercial importance of chickens and ducks.
